challenge.copy: You’re running out of money fast. It’s time to get a job – any job. Here’s what’s available. Click a listing to apply:
challenge.title: Find a Job

challenge.copy: Congratulations on getting a job! Would you like to opt in for health insurance? Your monthly premium is $275.
challenge.title: Health Insurance

challenge.copy: Monthly Rent Cost Range: $850 @ 0 miles — $600 @ 50 milesMonthly Gas Costs: .08/mile x number of miles to work and back x 40 tripsCombined total is what comes out of the account.
challenge.title: Find a Place to Live

challenge.copy:
Your new apartment is too small
for your stuff.

option.@title: Ask a friend to store it

challenge.title: Storage Unit

challenge.copy: You’ve been charged a $5 bank fee because your account is below $50.
challenge.title: Bank Fee

challenge.copy: You are working on some filing when you hear two full-time employees talking about you in a very unflattering way and saying things that simply aren’t true.
challenge.title: Temp_Conflict with FullTimers_JOB

challenge.copy: You’re working today at a retail store, helping them prepare for their grand opening. As you pick up a $25 vase, it slips from your hand and shatters. Nobody notices.
challenge.title: Temp_Break Something_JOB

challenge.copy: Remember that vase you broke? The owner of the shop called the temp agency and accused your co-worker of breaking it and hiding the evidence.
challenge.title: Temp_Break Something2_JOB

challenge.copy: Two bills are due today.
challenge.title: Which Bill to Pay_Cell Phone or Insurance

challenge.copy: Two bills are due today.
challenge.title: Which Bill to Pay_Gas or Electric

challenge.copy: Money may be tight, but you still need to eat – it’s time to go shopping. These groceries need to last you a few weeks, so choose wisely.
challenge.title: Grocery Shopping

challenge.copy: The phone rings: “Answer it”“Hello. I’m calling from Consumer Collections Corp about the overdue charges on a vehicle in your possession.”
challenge.title: Creditor Calls_JOB

challenge.copy: Your car has been repossessed – guess you shouldn’t have hung up on that creditor.Since you can’t get to work, your boss has to let you go. No job = no more paychecks.
challenge.title: Car Repossessed_JOB

challenge.copy: Without warning, your landlord has raised your rent, effective immediately. When you argue that the increase is illegal, you’re told, “If you don’t like it, you can move out.”
challenge.title: Rent Hike_JOB

challenge.copy: On the way to drop off your kid at school, something blew in your car. You don’t know what’s wrong, but it can’t be good.
challenge.title: Your Car Broke Down

challenge.copy: Your car's registration is due, but it’ll cost $250 to get it road-legal.
challenge.title: Car Registration

challenge.copy:
Your tooth has been hurting for weeks, and it’s starting to get unbearable. You need a root canal, but you don’t have
dental insurance.
challenge.title: Toothache

challenge.copy: Your credit card kept you afloat while you were trying to hold onto your home. But even though the house is gone, the balance isn’t.
challenge.title: Credit Card Bill - JOB

challenge.copy: Your child has been invited to a birthday party. They need to bring a present.

option.@title: Send your kid without a present
Keep your kid home from the party

challenge.title: Birthday Party

challenge.copy: You come out of your house to discover that someone has siphoned the gas from your car. And you’re already running late for work.

option.@title: Ask a friend for a ride

challenge.title: Out of Gas_JOB_WT

challenge.copy:
Your child’s class is going on a field trip to the natural history museum.
The trip costs $15.
challenge.title: Field Trip

challenge.copy: One of your co-workers has gotten seriously ill. Because your company doesn’t offer sick days, everyone is contributing $20 to help her out.
challenge.title: Sick Co-worker _JOB

challenge.copy:
Your head is pounding and you’re burning up. But you have to be at work
in an hour.
challenge.title: The Flu_JOB_S

challenge.copy:
Your head is pounding and you’re burning up. But you have to be at work
in an hour.
challenge.title: The Flu_JOB_WT

challenge.copy: The flu has been going around – and it just hit your house. Your child is running a fever and has the chills. But you’re supposed to be at work.
challenge.title: Sick Child_JOB_S

challenge.copy: The flu has been going around – and it just hit your house. Your child is running a fever and has the chills. But you’re supposed to be at work.
challenge.title: Sick Child_JOB_WT

challenge.copy:
You’ve been working for several hours, and you’re starving. But you forgot
your lunch.

option.@title: Buy a burger from the dollar menu

challenge.title: Forgot Your Lunch _JOB

challenge.copy:
Your best friend from childhood is getting married, and they want you to be in the wedding. The only problem: It’s in
another state.

option.@title: Tell your friend you won’t be there

challenge.title: Your Friend’s Wedding_JOB_S

challenge.copy: Your best friend from childhood is getting married, and they want you to be in the wedding. The only problem: It’s in another state.

option.@title: Tell your friend you won’t be there

challenge.title: Your Friend’s Wedding_JOB_WT

challenge.copy: Your kid has a friend over when you hear the telltale sound of the ice cream truck. They both run over to the truck.
challenge.title: Ice Cream Truck

challenge.copy: You’re driving with your kid in the backseat when your car slips on a slick stretch of road and slides into a parked car, causing a big dent in the bumper and a broken taillight.
challenge.title: Accident

challenge.copy: A bunch of friends are going to a free concert tonight, and you want to go – but you’ve got a kid to worry about.
challenge.title: Night Out

challenge.copy: Everyone is pitching in for a lottery pool.
challenge.title: Play the Lottery

challenge.copy: Your child is above average in language skills but is struggling with math.
challenge.title: Math Help

challenge.copy: Your child has been identified as gifted and invited into the school’s gifted program. The materials for the course cost $50.
challenge.title: Gifted Program_JOB_S

challenge.copy: Your child has been identified as gifted and invited into the school’s gifted program. The materials for the course cost $50.
challenge.title: Gifted Program_JOB_WT

challenge.copy: You’ve been putting off doing laundry for weeks because you don’t have a washer or dryer.
challenge.title: Laundry Day

challenge.copy:
Your mom needs crucial medication but doesn’t have the $100 she needs
to buy it.
challenge.title: Help Mom or Not?

challenge.copy:
Your income level qualifies you for
food stamps.
challenge.title: Food Stamps

challenge.copy: You’re walking down the street when you see someone drop a $10 bill.
challenge.title: To Steal or Not to Steal

challenge.copy: A family friend sends your child a card. Inside is $10.
challenge.title: Your Kid Gets a Present

challenge.copy: Your grandfather has passed away. You’ve always been very close to him, and you want to go to the memorial service, which is being held several states away.
challenge.title: Funeral_JOB_S

challenge.copy: Your grandfather has passed away. You’ve always been very close to him, and you want to go to the memorial service, which is being held several states away.
challenge.title: Funeral_JOB_WT

challenge.copy:
Your landlord found out that you have a pet, and now you have to pay a
$350 pet fee.

option.@title: Ask a friend to take your pet
Take your pet to the animal shelter

challenge.title: Family Pet_Pet Fee

challenge.copy: Your family pet is sick and won’t get better without treatment.
challenge.title: Family Pet_Sick

challenge.copy: Trying to keep your family afloat is wearing you down. You think you might be depressed.
challenge.title: Depression_no insurance

challenge.copy: Trying to keep your family afloat is wearing you down. You think you might be depressed.
challenge.title: Depression_insurance

challenge.copy: You check your work schedule for next week and discover that you’ve been moved to the midday shift, which means fewer customers and way fewer tips. Future paychecks will be about $75 short.
challenge.title: Server Challenge_Shift Change_JOB

challenge.copy: You’re carrying a stack of plates to the back when you drop your tray, shattering them all. Everyone else is on the floor, so nobody saw you do it.
challenge.title: Server Challenge_Break Something_JOB

challenge.copy: Your supervisor discovered the plates you broke but blames your co-worker.
challenge.title: Server Challenge_Break Something2_JOB

challenge.copy: Your company has introduced an option where, instead of being paid by the hour, you can be paid by the piece.
challenge.title: Warehouse Challenges_PayPiece_JOB

challenge.copy: The repetitive work you do is taking its toll. Your back hurts so badly you can barely stand, and it’s only the beginning of your shift.
challenge.title: Warehouse Challenge_Injury_JOB

challenge.copy: You weren’t paying attention, and you broke something as you were putting it into a box.

option.@title: Pay $25 to cover the broken item

challenge.title: Warehouse Challenge_Break Something_JOB

challenge.copy: Your supervisor discovered the broken item you hid but blames your co-worker.
challenge.title: Warehouse Challenge_Break Something2_JOB

challenge.copy: You ended your work at one company and are waiting for another call from the temp agency. Unfortunately, this is a slow week, and you miss three days of work.
challenge.title: Temp Challenge_JOB

challenge.copy: The local community college is offering an online course in computer science, which could be your ticket to a higher paycheck. But the class costs $200.
challenge.title: Higher Education

challenge.copy:
Your child comes home in tears and threatens to stop eating lunch because other kids made fun of all the
“free lunch kids.”

option.@title: Add lunch money to your monthly budget ($3/day)

challenge.title: Free Lunch

challenge.copy: You’re walking into work when someone approaches you in the parking lot. They want to organize a union and push for better pay.
challenge.title: Organizer_JOB

challenge.copy: Your neighbor is moving and has offered to pay you $50 to help. But they reserved the truck during the time your kid will be starring in a school play.
challenge.title: Extra Work

challenge.copy: Your grandfather has passed away. You’ve always been very close to him, and you want to go to the memorial service, which is being held several states away.
challenge.title: Funeral

challenge.copy: Your best friend from childhood is getting married, and they want you to be in the wedding. The only problem: It’s in another state.
challenge.title: Wedding

challenge.copy: Your child has been identified as gifted and invited into the school’s gifted program. The materials for the course cost $50.
challenge.title: Gifted Program

challenge.copy:
Your child wants to join an after-school sports team, which requires a
physical and uniform.
challenge.title: Athletics

challenge.copy: You come out of your house to discover that someone has siphoned the gas from your car. And you’re already running late for work.

option.@title: Ask a friend for a ride

challenge.title: OutofGas_JOB_S

challenge.copy:
Life throws curveballs, and so does a kid on your block. He shattered your window, and your landlord insists you pay
$100 to fix it.

option.@title: Buy some plastic to put over the broken window ($5)

challenge.title: Broken Window

challenge.copy: You’ve been experiencing some sharp pains in your chest lately, and your family has a history of heart problems.
challenge.title: Chest Pains (no insurance)

challenge.copy: A little exercise goes a long way, both for keeping you healthy and relieving stress. You need to start a regular fitness regimen.

option.@title: Ask a friend to be your running buddy

challenge.title: Fitness Program

challenge.copy:
It’s easier to look for extra ways to make money if you have access to the Web. But you don’t have Internet at home
since you moved.

option.@title: Sign up for home Internet ($60 a month)
Get online at the public library

challenge.title: Home Internet

challenge.copy: You’re helping out the dishwasher during a lull when you accidentally get bleach all over your uniform shirt.
challenge.title: Server_Bleach_JOB

challenge.copy: A neighbor stops by and offers you a hand-me-down coat from their family; yours is in tatters.
challenge.title: Charitable Neighbor

challenge.copy: Your bathroom sink has a small leak that just became a big leak. Your landlord won’t return your calls, and you can’t put it off any longer.
challenge.title: Pipes

challenge.copy: Your stress level is through the roof these days. A friend who hears you venting offers you a cigarette to take the edge off.
challenge.title: Smoking

challenge.copy: You’re sure you weren’t speeding, but the cop who gave you a ticket disagrees.
challenge.title: Speeding Ticket

challenge.copy: Your child’s sneakers are falling apart and it’s time to buy new ones. Name brands are important, but they don’t come cheap.
challenge.title: New Shoes

challenge.copy: A friend of a friend needs a place to stay. He’s offered you $200 to camp out in your living room.
challenge.title: Friend of a Friend

challenge.copy: Your roommate may have given you another $200, but he brought a whole lot of problems, staying up all night and partying in your house. And he’s not about to move out.

option.@title: Ask your landlord to evict him

challenge.title: Friend of a Friend 2

challenge.copy: Your college degree isn’t helping you right now, but you still have to pay your loans. You just got a bill for $250.
challenge.title: College Loans

challenge.copy: You’ve been experiencing some sharp pains in your chest lately, and your family has a history of heart problems.
challenge.title: Chest Pains (insurance)

challenge.copy: During a routine traffic stop, a police officer spotted your expired registration tags. Your car’s been impounded and it’ll cost $1,500 to get it back.
challenge.title: Impounded_JOB
